data.event: At its northwestern corner is the Hillarys Boat Harbour, built in the late 1980s.
A private subdivision of freehold land known as 'Sorrento' was surveyed here in 1929.

event.title: operated a whaling station in the area in 1849

data.event: The first European to settle in the area was Patrick Marmion, master whaler, who operated a whaling station in the area in 1849.

event.title: the 1930s, and numerous boatsheds and shacks were built

data.event: The area was popular with fishermen in the 1930s, and numerous boatsheds and shacks were built there.
Residential settlement commenced in the early 1950s and until 1981, it was part of the suburb of Marmion.
